name: Morgan Wallen
description:
'''Morgan Cole Wallen''' (born May 13, 1993) is an American [[country pop]] singer from [[Sneedville, Tennessee]]. He competed in the [[The Voice (American season 6)|sixth season]] of ''[[The Voice (American TV series)|The Voice]]''. After being eliminated in the playoffs, he signed to [[Panacea Records]] and released his debut extended play ''[[Stand Alone (EP)|Stand Alone]]'' (2015). Later in 2016, Wallen signed to [[Big Loud]] to release his second extended play ''[[The Way I Talk#Track listings|The Way I Talk]]'' (2016). His debut studio album ''[[If I Know Me (album)|If I Know Me]]'' (2018) included four singles: "[[The Way I Talk]]", "[[Up Down (Morgan Wallen song)|Up Down]]" (featuring [[Florida Georgia Line]]), "[[Whiskey Glasses]]", and "[[Chasin' You]]". ''If I Know Me'' reached the top position on the [[Top Country Albums|''Billboard'' Top Country Albums]] chart after a record-breaking 114 weeks.

Wallen's second studio album ''[[Dangerous: The Double Album]]'' (2021) was an immediate commercial success, becoming the first country album to spend its first seven weeks atop the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] chart. The album spent the three following weeks at number one, thus spending its first ten weeks atop the chart. ''Dangerous: The Double Album'' included four singles: "[[More Than My Hometown]]", "[[7 Summers]]", "[[Sand in My Boots]]", and "[[Wasted on You (Morgan Wallen song)|Wasted on You]]", as well as various promotional singles.

Wallen's third studio album ''[[One Thing at a Time]]'' (2023) spent its first 12 weeks atop the ''Billboard'' 200, and topped the ''Billboard'' 200 for seven more non-consecutive weeks throughout 2023 and 2024, thus spending 19 non-consecutive weeks atop the chart. All 36 tracks from the album charted on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] simultaneously, breaking the record set by [[Drake (musician)|Drake]] (27), Wallen additionally charted five tracks in the top-ten of the chart. The album spawned eight singles: "[[You Proof]]", "[[Thought You Should Know (Morgan Wallen song)|Thought You Should Know]]", "[[Last Night (Morgan Wallen song)|Last Night]]", [[One Thing at a Time (song)|the title track]], "[[Everything I Love (Morgan Wallen song)|Everything I Love]]",  "[[Thinkin' Bout Me]]", "[[Man Made a Bar]]" (featuring [[Eric Church]]), and "[[Cowgirls (song)|Cowgirls]]" (featuring [[Ernest (singer)|Ernest]]). The single "Last Night" peaked atop the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, marking Wallen's first number-one single on this chart, spent sixteen non-consecutive weeks atop the chart throughout 2023, and topped the 2023 year-end chart.

Wallen's fourth studio album ''[[I'm the Problem (Morgan Wallen album)|I'm the Problem]]'' was released on May 16, 2025. It peaked atop the ''Billboard'' 200 for four consecutive weeks and spawned the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 chart-topping singles "[[Love Somebody (Morgan Wallen song)|Love Somebody]]" and "[[What I Want (Morgan Wallen song)|What I Want]]" (featuring [[Tate McRae]]). 36 of the 37 tracks from the album charted on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, and six charted in the top 10, which gave Wallen the record as the first country artist to do so.

Wallen has been praised for his cross-genre appeal and cultural impact. He has also received several accolades, including an [[Academy of Country Music Awards|Academy of Country Music Award]], fourteen [[Billboard Music Awards|''Billboard'' Music Awards]], and won [[Country Music Association Award for Entertainer of the Year|Entertainer of the Year]] at the [[58th Annual Country Music Association Awards]]. Aside from his various accolades, Wallen holds multiple ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' chart records: Wallen is the only artist to have two albums spend at least 100 weeks in the top ten of the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]], the only artist to have two albums spend at least 10 first-weeks atop the ''Billboard'' 200, the artist with the most weeks at number-one on the [[Top Country Albums]] chart (187), and his single "[[You Proof]]" is the longest-running [[Country Airplay|''Billboard'' Country Airplay]] number-one of all time, with ten non-consecutive weeks atop the chart.
